tuv.seg: Safety of toys and products made for children
Sábháilteacht bréagán agus táirgí do leanaí
There are specific rules in Ireland and the EU to protect children from playing with unsafe toys
Tá rialacha faoi leith in Éirinn agus san Aontas Eorpach chun leanaí a chosaint ó bhréagáin chontúirteacha agus iad ag déanamh spraoi
Specific rules also exist for ensuring the safety of children’s products, for example, baby prams, pushchairs, pacifiers (soothers), cots and clothing
Tá rialacha ar leith freisin le sábháilteacht na dtáirgí leanaí a chinntiú. Mar shampla, pramanna, bugaithe linbh, ciúnaitheoirí, cliabháin agus éadaí
Equipment such as swings, slides, pencils and pens are also regulated
Rialaítear áilleagáin agus trealamh cosúil le luascáin, sleamhnáin, pinn luaidhe agus pinn freisin
Most of these rules are based on the standards which are developed by the European Committee for standardisation (CEN)
Tá an chuid is mó de na rialacha seo bunaithe ar na caighdeáin atá forbartha ag an gCoiste Eorpach um Chaighdeánú (CEN)
The National Standards Authority of Ireland (NSAI) develops standards governing safety, quality, design, performance of specific products for sale in Ireland
Forbraíonn an tÚdarás Náisiúnta Caighdeán na hÉireann (NSAI) caighdeáin a rialaíonn sábháilteacht, cáilíocht, dearadh agus feidhmiú táirgí faoi leith atá ar díol in Éirinn
Since 1990, legislation has been in place in Ireland which prohibits the placing of toys on the market unless they meet minimum safety requirements
Ón mbliain 1990 i leith, tá reachtaíocht in Éirinn a chuireann cosc ar bhréagáin a chur ar an margadh mura mbaineann siad na bunriachtanais sábháilteachta amach
The European Communities (Safety of Toys) Regulations 2011 (SI 14/2011) (as amended) transposed Directive 2009/48/EC (as amended) on the safety of toys
Thrasuigh Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Sábháilteacht Bhréagán), 2011 (I.R. 14/2011) Treoir 2009/48/CE ar shábháilteacht bhréagán
The Directive prohibits the placing of toys on the market unless they are safe, and updates the safety requirements
Cuireann an Treoir toirmeasc ar bhréagáin a chur sa mhargadh mura bhfuil siad sábháilte, agus nuashonraíonn sí na riachtanais sábháilteachta
It also sets down a requirement to ensure risk assessment is carried out for toys
Anuas air sin, leagtar síos sa Treoir ceanglas lena chinntiú go dtugtar faoi mheasúnú riosca ar bhréagáin
Toys placed on the market prior to the making of these Regulations are covered by SI 32/1990 which sets out the safety requirements for toys applicable
Tá bréagáin a chuirtear ar an margadh sula ndearnadh na Rialacháin seo cumhdaithe ag I.R. 32/1990 ina leagtar amach na riachtanais sábháilteachta do bhréagáin atá infheidhme
In addition, EU rules state that any product offered for sale in the EU that conforms with certain specific health, safety and environmental protection standards must carry a CE mark

Lena chois sin, maíonn rialacha an Aontais Eorpaigh go gcaithfidh gach táirge a thairgtear ar díol san Aontas Eorpach agus a chomhlíonann caighdeáin chosanta áirithe sláinte, sábháilteachta agus timpeallachta, marc CE a iompar
The CE mark is a declaration by the producer that the product conforms to all the applicable EU legislation
Is lipéad le dronuilleog bhán é an marc CE ar tháirge ar a bhfuil na litreacha CE i litreacha dubha
Read about the the CE mark
Breathnaigh ar an marc CE
A toy is defined in the law as a product intended for children aged under 14 to play with
Is é an sainmhíniú a thugtar ar bhréagán sa dlí ná táirge a mbeartaítear go mbainfidh leanaí faoi 14 bliana d’aois úsáid as chun súgradh leis
It does not include products listed in Annex I of Directive 2009/48/EC (pdf)
Ní áirítear táirgí atá liostaithe in Aguisín I de Threoir 2009/48/CE leis (pdf)
Equipment children may use (such as sports equipment) that are not toys come under the General Product Safety Directive
Tagann trealamh ar féidir le leanaí úsáid a bhaint as (ar nós trealamh spóirt), nach bréagáin iad, faoi chuimsiú na Treorach um Shábháilteacht Ghinearálta Táirgí
General guidelines for buying safe products for children
Treoirlínte ginearálta chun táirgí sábháilte a cheannach do leanaí
The following are some basic guidelines when buying safe products and toys
Seo a leanas roinnt treoirlínte ginearálta agus tú ag ceannach táirgí sábháilte agus bréagáin
• strong and resilient (i.e., should not break easily)
• láidir agus buanfasach (i.e., níor cheart go mbrisfeadh siad go héasca)
• made of materials that do not burn easily
• déanta d’ábhar nach ndófadh ró-éasca
• carry the CE mark
• ag iompar mairc CE
A child’s product that contains detachable or small parts should be marked as unsuitable for children under 36 months
Ba cheart go gcuirfí in iúl nach bhfuil bréagán feiliúnach do leanaí faoi 36 mí má tá píosaí inscortha istigh leis
Any specific hazard that exists should be drawn to your attention
Ba cheart go dtugtar le fios duit má tá aon chontúirt faoi leith ag baint leis
Bicycles and go-karts etc
Ba cheart go mbeadh coscáin sásúla ag rothair agus ag cairtíní srl
should have adequate brakes and guards for chains and other moving parts
chomh maith le sciath do shlabhraí agus píosaí eile a bhíonn ag bogadh
If being used on public roads, bicycles should carry adequate lighting
Má bhaintear úsáid astu ar bhóithre poiblí, ba cheart go mbeadh an soilsiú leormhaith ar rothair
Safe use of children’s products
Úsáid shábháilte de tháirgí leanaí
It is common sense to ensure that toys are used safely
Is ciallmhar an rud é a dhéanamh cinnte go n-úsáidtear bréagáin go sábháilte
Toys with a CE mark indicate that they are safe to use as they were intended to be
Sonraíonn bréagáin leis an marc CE go bhfuil siad sábháilte le húsáid mar ba cheart
That is, for the age group they are considered appropriate to
Is é sin, don aoisghrúpa a fheileann don bhréagán
For example, a toy suitable for a ten year old can be dangerous if played with by a three year old
Mar shampla, is féidir le bréagán a fheileann do ghasúir atá deich mbliana d’aois a bheith contúirteach do ghasúr atá trí bliana déag d’aois
Electrical toys should carry the CE mark to ensure compliance with EU safety standards
Ba cheart go n-iompródh bréagáin leictreacha an marc CE le cinntiú go leantar caighdeáin sábháilteachta an Aontais Eorpaigh
No electrical toy should be sold (or given out for free) that exceeds 24 volts
Níor cheart go ndíolfaí aon bhréagán leictreach le níos mó ná 24 volta
Electrical items (such as lamps etc.) exist that are intended to appeal to children but these are most definitely NOT toys and should carry a label accordingly worded

(Ní hé seo an scéal iomlán. Níl ann do mhíreanna leictreacha atá dírithe ar leanaí, go háirithe lampaí ach is cinnte NACH bréagáin iad seo agus ba cheart go n-iompródh siad lipéad le foclaíocht dá réir sin.) Ba cheart go mbeadh gach cuid den bhréagán inslithe i gceart chun teagmháil le sreanga beo a sheachaint
All parts of the toy should be properly insulated to prevent a risk of contact with live wires. Safety instructions on electrical toys should be clear and precise and should be heeded by consumers
Ní mór do threoracha sábháilteachta ar bhréagáin leictreacha a bheith soiléir agus beacht agus ba cheart go gcloífeadh tomhaltóirí leo
Toys and children’s product labelling
Bréagáin agus lipéadú táirgí leanaí
The following information should appear on the packaging or the product itself
Ba cheart go bhfeicfeá an t-eolas seo a leanas ar an bpacáistiú nó ar an táirge é féin
• Name, trade mark and address of the manufacturer, his agent or importer within the European Union
• Ainm, trádmharc agus seoladh an déantúsóra, a ghníomhaire nó a allmhaireoir laistigh den Aontas Eorpach
• Instructions for use, if any
• Treoracha chun é a úsáid, más ann dóibh
• Advice on the safe use of the toy (such as ‘unsuitable for children under 36 months’)
• Comhairle ar úsáid shábháilte an bhréagáin (cuir i gcás, ‘mí-oiriúnach do leanaí faoi 36 mí’)
The Irish technical standard mark can be placed on the toy along with the CE mark
Is féidir marc caighdeáin teicniúil na hÉireann a chur ar an mbréagán i dteannta an mhairc CE
This indicates that the toy complies with all safety regulations
Sonraíonn sé seo go leanann an bréagán na rialacháin sábháilteachta go léir
The most common Standard for Toys is called IS EN 71
Is é an Caighdeán do Bhréagáin is coitianta ná IS EN 71
If you suspect that a toy is unsafe you should contact the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission(CCPC) who will investigate the matter
Má tá amhras ort go bhfuil bréagán mí-shábháilte, ní mór duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí (CCPC) a dhéanfaidh fiosrúchán ar an scéal
Similarly, if you or a child has been harmed by a toy, you should also contact the CCPC for advice and information
Ar an dul céanna, má dhéanann bréagán dochar duit féin nó do pháiste, ba cheart duit dul i dteagmháil leis an CCPC le haghaidh comhairle agus eolais
You can find more information in the CCPC's booklet on toy safety (pdf)
Féadfaidh tú teacht ar bhreis faisnéise i leabhráin an CICT ar shábháilteacht bhréagáin (pdf)
